articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and supreme leader of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK, together with members of the WPK Central Military Commission and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, major commanding  officers of the KPA, staff members of the KPA Supreme Command and commanding officers of KPA large combined units, Saturday visited the bier of leader Kim Jong Il and expressed profound condolences.
					
					 The Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the bier of Kim Jong Il lies in state is wrapped in a solemn atmosphere.
					
					 His bier is bedecked with flowers and his body is draped with a red flag associated with his lifelong desire.
					
					 Seen in the mourning place was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un.
					
					  Members of the National Funeral Committee were standing vigil by the side of the bier and guards of honor of the three services of the Korean People's Army and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards were standing on either side of the bier.
					
					 He entered the hall where the bier is placed, together with members of the WPK Central Military Commission and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, major commanding officers of the KPA, staff members of the KPA Supreme Command and commanding officers of KPA large combined units.
					
					 Overwhelmed with bitterest grief he, together with commanding officers, paid silent tribute to the bier of Kim Jong Il, praying for his immortality, carrying with him the unbounded yearning of all servicepersons, and went round the bier.
					
					 The participants renewed their firm pledge to thoroughly embody the supreme commander's undying feats performed in commanding the army in its building and military activities, regarding them as a lifeline, and let the whole army remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un over the army, holding aloft the slogan "Let us defend with our very lives the Party Central Committee headed by respected Comrade Kim Jong Un!" and thus firmly defend the socialist homeland and guarantee the cause of building a powerful and prosperous country with arms.

articles.title: Syrian President Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Syrian President Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad expressed profound condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Upon the authorization, the chamberlain of the Syrian president on December 21 paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Damascus to convey the following message of condolences:
					
					  I share sorrow with the Korean people over the demise of HE leader Kim Jong Il and express the most profound condolences to the leadership, party, government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the Syrian leadership, party, government and people.
					
					 HE leader Kim Jong Il was a great man who made a great contribution to the development of the friendly relations between Syria and the DPRK and made a distinguished contribution to the accomplishment of the cause of independence against imperialism, upholding the cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will overcome the sorrow over the demise of HE leader Kim Jong Il and carry forward and accomplish his cause, united close around HE Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 Meanwhile, first vice-foreign minister and vice-foreign minister of Syria, the general secretary of the Arab Socialistsâ€™Movement of Syria, the general secretary of the Arab Democratic Union Party and the general secretary of the Popular Front For the Liberation of Palestine paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy and expressed profound condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: President of South Africa Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
President of South Africa Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- President Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma and Minister of the International Relations and Cooperation Maite Nkoana-Mashabane of South Africa expressed their deepest condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Upon authorization of them, a department director of the Ministry of International Relations and Cooperation conveyed their condolences to the DPRK embassy on Dec. 21 when he paid a condolatory visit to it.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Indonesian President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Indonesian President

					Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the DPRK, Thursday received a message of condolences from Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of Indonesia.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il is, indeed, the greatest loss to the government and people of the DPRK.
					
					 I, on behalf of the Indonesian government and people and on my own, express deep condolences to Your Excellency and through you to the government and people of the DPRK.
					
					 I am convinced that the exploits of HE Kim Jong Il, his desire for building the DPRK as a thriving country, in particular, and his feats and his efforts made for the development of the bilateral ties between the DPRK and Indonesia will be remembered forever.
					
					 I, praying for soul of HE Kim Jong Il, hope the Korean will overcome the indescribable sorrow over the loss with strength and courage.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Thai King
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Thai King

					 Pyongyang December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Thai King Bhumibol Adulyadej on Dec. 23. 
					
					 The king, in the message, said that he and the queen were deeply saddened to learn about the sad news of the demise of leader               Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 He extended sympathy and condolences to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK over the tremendous loss to the country and its people.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Kenyan President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Kenyan President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday received a message of condolences from Mwai Kibaki, president of Kenya.
					
					 The message said.
					
					 It was with bitter sorrow and grief that I heard the sad news that HE Chairman Kim Jong Il passed away on Dec. 17, 2011.
					
					 I, on behalf of the government and people of the Republic of Kenya and on my own behalf, express most profound condolences to Your Excellency and, through you, to the government and people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The Kenyan people are sharing the sorrow with your people in this hard period. 
					
					 I hope all the Korean people would overcome bitter sorrow and display strength and courage.
					
					 Please, Your Excellency, accept deepest sympathy and assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Sri Lankan President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Sri Lankan President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Wednesday received a condolence message from Mahinda Rajapaksa, president of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It is with great sadness that I have learned the demise of His Excellency Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The Sri Lankan government and people extend the deepest condolences to the DPRK government and people at this sad time.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Zambian President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Zambian President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Zambian President Michael Chilufya Sata on Dec. 21.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It was with bitter sorrow that I have learned the sad news of the sudden demise of Chairman Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I, on behalf of the Zambian government and people and on my own behalf, express our heartfelt condolences to you and the Korean people.
					
					 I am sharing the bitter sorrow with you mourning for HE the dear leader, and hope that you will overcome the grief at this great loss with indomitable will.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from President of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from President of Democratic Congo

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Friday received a message of condolences from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It was with bitter sorrow that I heard the sad news that the great leader Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, passed away.
					
					 I, on behalf of all people of Democratic Congo and on my own, express most profound condolences to you and share sorrow over the loss with the Korean people. 
					
					 May the soul of the prominent leader rest in peace. 
					
					 Please, Your Excellency vice-chairman, accept assurances of highest consideration.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Armenian President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Armenian President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Serge Sarkissian, president of Armenia, on Monday.
					
					 The president in the message said on behalf of the Armenian people and on his own he expresses profound condolences over the demise of His Excellency Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He hoped the Korean people would display fortitude and indomitable will.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Lebanese President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Lebanese President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Friday received a message of condolences from Lebanese President Michel Souleyman.
					
					 The message said that it was with sorrow that he heard the news about passing of HE Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's demise left great pain in your heart and those of the Korean people, the message said.
					
					 It extended heartfelt and profound condolences to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the DPRK and the Korean people stability and peace all the time.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from President of Seychelles
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from President of Seychelles

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolence message from James Alix Michel, president of Seychelles, on Thursday.
					
					 The president in the message said:
					
					 I heard in bitter grief the sad news that His Excellency Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the DPRK, passed away.
					
					 The government and people of Seychelles extend heartfelt condolences to you and to the government and people of the DPRK at the sad news.
					
					 I express belief that the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK would grow stronger. Accept the assurances of my highest consideration.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Angolan President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Angolan President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolence message from Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola Tuesday.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 It was with bitter grief and sorrow that I heard the news that HE Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workersâ€™ Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean Peopleâ€™s Army, passed away from illness.
					
					 At this time of loss, I, on behalf of the government of Angola and on my own, express the most profound condolences to Your Excellency and the government and people of the DPRK in reverence for the leader of the DPRK who worked hard for the peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from UN Secretary General
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from UN Secretary General

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon sent a condolence message to the government of the DPRK Friday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He, on behalf of all the UN organizations, expressed condolences once again to the government and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The people of the DPRK are looking forward to the future amid the sorrow at the loss of their leader, the message said.
					
					 Ban hoped that the people of the DPRK would make progress in their efforts to ensure peace, stability and development.
					
					 As UN secretary general, he reaffirmed his commitment to peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 He also assured the continued support of all the UN organizations for the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Nicaraguan President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Nicaraguan President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday received a message of condolences from Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega Saavedra.
					
					 In the message he, on behalf of the Sandinist National Liberation Front, expressed heartfelt condolences and sympathy to the WPK, the DPRK government and the fraternal Korean people.
					
					 We are sure that the Korean people with ability to stubbornly realize their desire will invariably go along the road of development chosen by themselves, the message said.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Chadian President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Chadian President

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Idriss Deby Itno, president of the Republic of Chad, on Dec. 19.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 We have learned with bitter sorrow and deep regret about the surprising news that HE Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, passed away of a sudden illness on December 17, 2011.
					
					 At this grievous time I, on behalf of the Chadian people and government and on my own behalf, express our heartfelt condolences to you and entrust you with respect to convey our sympathy to the people of your country.
					
					 Please accept my deep condolences to you again.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from PM of Bahrain
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from PM of Bahrain

					Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Thursday received a message of condolences from Sheikh Khalifa Bin Sulman al-Khalifa, prime minister of Bahrain. 
					
					It is with deep sorrow that I have received the passing away of His Excellency leader Kim Jong Il, the prime minister said.
					
					We share the sorrow with Kim Jong Un, he said, extending the assurances of highest consideration to him.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from WIPO Director General
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from WIPO Director General

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Francis Gurry, director general of the World Intellectual Property Organization, on Dec. 21.
					
					 The director general in the message expressed condolences to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people in the name of the WIPO and the director general.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Socialist Workers' Party of US
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Socialist Workers' Party of US

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea received a message of condolences from Jack Barnes, national secretary of the Socialist Workers' Party of the United States of America, on December 21 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The message said that the Socialist Workers' Party of the U.S. expresses condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					
					 It reiterated support to the Korean people in their struggle to reunify the country and seek the withdrawal of all U.S. forces, aircraft, ships and conventional and nuclear weapons from Korea and the Pacific.
					
					 Korea is one, it noted, extending comradely salute.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Syrian Party Leaders
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Syrian Party Leaders

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received messages of condolences from Safwan Koudsi, general secretary of the Syrian Arab Socialist Union Party, and Gassan Ahmad Osman, general secretary of the Arab Democratic Alliance Party and member of the Central Direction of the National Progressive Front, on Dec. 20.
					
					 Safwan Koudsi in the message said that the demise of leader Kim Jong Il is the great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the world people who are waging the struggle, following his example.
					
					 Expressing belief that Kim Jong Un would most creditably discharge the heavy responsibility he has assumed, the messages wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Equatorial Guinean Party Leader
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Equatorial Guinean Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, on Dec. 21 sent a message of condolences to the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The message said that he received the news that leader Kim Jong Il passed away.
					
					 Upon authorization of the president, he, on behalf of all the party members, expressed the most profound condolences to the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and its Vice-Chairman Kim Jong Un who undergo bitter sorrow and irrevocable grief of loss, it noted, wishing for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Foreign Party Leaders
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Foreign Party Leaders

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea received messages of condolences from Sergei Stanishev, chairman of the National Council of the Bulgarian Socialist Party, the general secretary of the Mongolian People's Party and A.B.Bardhan, general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, on Dec. 20 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Expressing the most profound sorrow over his demise, the messages expressed belief that the Korean people would overcome the grief with strength and courage and weather the present difficulties.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Foreign Parties
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Foreign Parties

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea received consolatory messages from the C.C., Communist Party of Greece, the C.C., New Yugoslav Communist Party and the Secretariat of the C.C., Communist Party of Portugal on Dec. 19 and 20 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The messages expressed heartfelt condolences and solidarity to the leadership of the WPK and the Korean people.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Foreign Political Parties
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Foreign Political Parties

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received messages of condolences from political parties and party leaders of different countries between Dec. 19 and 21.
					
					 They included Secretary General of the African National Congress of South Africa Gwede Mantashe, Chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union Constantin Rotaru and the Central Committee of the Slovak Communist Party.
					
					 The messages expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Praising his exploits, they stressed that his noble revolutionary spirit would remain forever.
					
					 They sincerely wished Kim Jong Un and the WPK and the Korean people fresh success in the cause of socialist construction.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Nepali Figures
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Nepali Figures

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Chairman Madhav Gyawali and Secretary Achyut Raj Gyawali of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist), Shyam Shrestha, member of its Central Committee, and Shyam Malla, member of its National Committee, on Wednesday.
					
					 The message said that the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist) expressed deep condolences over the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people. His demise is a great loss to the world communist movement, it noted.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was standing in the van of the struggle against imperialism and had always wisely led the WPK and the Korean people, it added.
					
					 The Nepal Communist Party (Marxist) heartily hopes that the WPK and the Korean people will dynamically advance without slightest hesitation and vacillation along the road indicated by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from S. Korean Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Press Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration Wednesday sent a message of condolences to the Press Panel of the North Side Committee on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In the message the organization said it can hardly repress regret and sorrow upon the sad news that Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il passed away.
					
					 He deeply impressed the compatriots in the south and the north and abroad and the world people by providing the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, it said.
					
					 Those declarations, a milestone for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, would shine long in the nation's history, it stressed.
					
					 It expressed sympathy with the compatriots in the north in grief at the loss of their leader, calling on the south and the north to overcome the sorrow and pain and put energies into the country's reunification.

articles.title: Mongolian High-ranking Officials Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Mongolian High-ranking Officials Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- High-ranking officials of Mongolia visited the DPRK embassy in Ulan Bator on Tuesday to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. They included Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, the minister of Foodstuff, Agriculture and Light Industry, the minister of Social Protection and Labor, D.Tsakhilgaan, president of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia, and D. Bilegt, its general secretary, and Ch. Surenjav, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society. 
					
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed condolences.
					
					 They made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: Cambodian Officials Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cambodian Officials Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Personages of Cambodia paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy on Dec. 20 and 21 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, and other officials of the ministry and the president of the Taekwon-Do Association of Cambodia.
					
					 They laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 Hor Nam Hong made an entry in the condolence book.

articles.title: Personages of Italy Visits DPRK
articles.content:
Personages of Italy Visits DPRK

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- 30 odd personages of different circles of Italy and a regional body visited the DPRK embassy in Rome on Dec. 20 to express condolences over demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were Roberto Gabriele, general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, Osvaldo Pesce, general secretary of the C.C., Unified Communist Party of Italy, and Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 They said in unison that the demise of Kim Jong Il is the great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the world progressives.
					
					 They hoped that the Korean people would overcome sorrow as early as possible and achieve great success in socialist construction under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, together with members of its leadership visited the DPRK embassy in Malabo on Dec. 21 to express condolences over demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il in front of his portrait.
					
					 The general secretary wrote in the condolence book:
					
					 The Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, on behalf of HE Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, its founder-chairman, expresses deep condolences to the Workers' Party of Korea suffering sorrow at the irrevocable loss of respected HE Kim Jong Il and extends solidarity to the fraternal Korean people spending unbearable hours.

articles.title: Mexican Political Figures Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Mexican Political Figures Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Mexican political and social figures paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Mexico Tuesday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included Ricardo Cantu Garza, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, and members of its leadership, Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, and members of its leadership, Selso Humberto Delgado Ramirez, international secretary of the Institutional Revolutionary Party of Mexico, Carlos Jimenez Macias, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee for Asia-Pacific, Hector Hernandez Silva, president of the Friendship Parliamentary Group, Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, and Arquimedez Perez Bello, its secretary general, Andres Gasca Sanchez, president of the Mexican Fellowship Institute to Honor the Memory of President Kim Il Sung and Alejandro Rosales Sanchez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification.
					
					 They placed wreaths at a portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed profound condolences.

articles.title: Figures of Nepali Political Parties Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Figures of Nepali Political Parties Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Pushpa Kamal Dahal, chairman of the C.C., Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), together with members of its Leadership, visited the DPRK embassy in Katmandu on Tuesday to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Those who called at the DPRK embassy to pay last respects to him from Tuesday to Thursday were Darmendra Raj Bastala, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the UCPN, Chairman Narayan Man Bijukchhe and members of the C.C., the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, the president of the United People's Front of Nepal, the chairman of the Revolutionary Students Union of Nepal, the chairman of the Revolutionary Youth Union of Nepal, the chairman and members of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal and the chairwoman and members of the Nepal Women's Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea. 
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before a portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute.

articles.title: Romanian Personages Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Romanian Personages Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, and members of its Leadership and the director of the Romanian Institute for International Studies, on Tuesday visited the DPRK embassy in Bucharest to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu said in profound sorrow:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was the greatest man who devoted his all to the happiness and prosperity of the Korean people and the cause of global independence all his life, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It was thanks to the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il that the U.S. and other hostile forces dared not hurt the dignity of the DPRK and peace and stability could be ensured on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Korean people will surely overcome the indescribable sorrow over the demise of Kim Jong Il and emerge victorious in the struggle to build a thriving socialist nation as they are led by Kim Jong Un, another great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 The director of the above-said institute noted that the future of the DPRK will be in safe hands and it will win victory after victory as it is led by Kim Jong Un, successor to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Egyptian Figure Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Egyptian Figure Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, former executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, visited the DPRK embassy in Cairo on December 21 to express condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 I can never forget the day when I was honored with the audience of leader Kim Jong Il during my visit to the DPRK, he said, adding that he was an excellent person.
					
					 He expressed the resolve to keep the promise made to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He wrote in the condolence book:
					
					 I express my deepest condolences with bitter grief on the demise of the great leader, a great and tender-hearted person whom I personally met and hold in high esteem as my best friend and my elder brother.
					
					 The memory of him will remain in our hearts.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Personages Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Personages Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Leaders of political parties of Bangladesh including Ghazi Zafar Ahmed, former prime minister, Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party, Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the National Socialist Party, Garib Newaz, president of the People's League, chiefs of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and the groups for the study of Juche idea, Songun idea visited the DPRK embassy in Dhaka on December 20 and 21 to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They laid wreaths before the portrait of leader Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences on his demise.
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Il wisely led the confrontation with imperialism and the U.S. under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea, Songun idea.
					
					 They expressed hope that the Korean people would successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche, single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Asian Institute of Juche Idea Official Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Asian Institute of Juche Idea Official Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Harish Gupta, director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea, paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in India Wednesday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He wrote in the condolence book that Kim Jong Il's sudden passing is a great loss not only to the Koreans but to the world progressives.
					
					 Kim Jong Il built the DPRK into a political and military power, he wrote, adding that Kim Jong Il loved the people very much and the people respected him. 
					
					 Harish Gupta wrote he can not repress bitter grief, extending solidarity to Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, and the brave Korean people.

articles.title: Director-General of IIJI Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Director-General of IIJI Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in New Delhi on Dec. 21 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He placed a bunch of flowers before Kim Jong Il's portrait and expressed deep condolences.
					
					 He wrote in the mourners' book:
					
					The loadstar of the world fell down.
					
					 The great man who was born to save mankind is no longer with us. 
					
					 There is no such great man as HE Kim Jong Il in the world. He is always with us.

articles.title: Iranians Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Iranians Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Hadi Gafori, chairman of the Al Hadi Islam Propaganda Organization of Iran who is chairman of the Iranian national preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and Fardi, secretary general and members of the International Taekwon-Do Association of Iran paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Tehran on Dec. 20 and 21 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed condolences over his demise.
					
					 The chairman said that Kim Jong Il's demise was a great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the Iranians and the world progressives.
					
					 He was a close friend of peoples of Iran and all other countries standing in the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. front, the secretary general stressed.
					
					 Meanwhile, diplomatic envoys of Thailand, Sudan, Tajikistan and Azerbaijan to Iran paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy on Wednesday.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Visits DPRK Consulate Genera
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Visits DPRK Consulate Genera

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Koreans including the vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia and the deputy chairman of the Association of Korean National Culture in Nakhodka City of Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation visited the DPRK consulate general in the city on Dec. 21 and 22 to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid a wreath and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The chairman of the Autonomous Association of the Korean National Culture in Ussuriysk City of Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation sent a message of condolences to the DPRK consulate general.
					
					 Condolences were expressed by the chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kamchatka Territory, the chairman of the Association of Korean Nationals in Territory and other officials and members of compatriots' organizations in the territory from Tuesday.
					
					 Sok Myong Son, chairman of the International United Confederation of Koreans, and other officials of Koreans organizations overseas, members of the Korean Cultural Center in Uzbekistan, editors of Thongil and Koryo Sinmun and heads of Korean art troupes and compatriots paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Uzbekistan.
					
					 Officials of Koreans organizations and compatriots laid bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il in bitter grief over his demise and paid silent tribute to him in humblest reverence.
					
					 On the same day, Ri Hui Se, permanent representative of the European Regional Committee of Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, visited the DPRK mission in France and mourned the demise of the leader.
					
					 He said that the immortal exploits performed by the chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK for accomplishing the cause of national reunification would be always remembered by all the Korean people.
					
					 Choe Hyon Suk, Korean in France, said she could not repress sorrow at the sad news that he passed away.

articles.title: UN Organizations Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise
articles.content:
UN Organizations Mourn Kim Jong Il's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Flags were hoisted at half mast at the building of the UN organizations in Bangkok, Thailand, which houses regional missions of the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and Pacific, the International Labor Organization, the United Nations Development Programme, the  United Nations Environment Programme, the United Nations Population Fund, the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and the United Nations Office for Services to Countries and the building of the Regional Office of Eastern Asia and Pacific of the United Nations Children's Fund on Friday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Wreath from Japanese Organization
articles.content:
Wreath from Japanese Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Miyagi Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association of Japan sent a wreath to the DPRK on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il displayed at Kim Il Sung Square on Saturday.
					
					 Earlier, a wreath from Rudy Tanoesoedibjo, a businessman of Indonesia, was placed before the portrait at the square on Friday.

articles.title: Wreath Laid by WPF Group
articles.content:
Wreath Laid by WPF Group

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- A mourners' visiting group of the World Peace Federation headed by its President Moon Hyung Jin Saturday laid a wreath before the portrait of leader Kim Jong Il with smile on his face at Kim Il Sung Square.
					
					 Amid the playing of the dirge, a wreath was laid before the portrait in the name of the group.
					
					 Members of the group observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il who dedicated his whole life to the country and the people and made immortal contributions to the cause of independent reunification of the country
					
					 This day, the group arrived here to mourn his demise.

articles.title: Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
articles.content:
Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Families of Shang Yue, Chen Lei and Hu Zhenyi, Chinese who are related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, arrived here Saturday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Here
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Here

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- A mourners group of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan led by Vice-Chairman of its Central Standing Committee Nam Sung U arrived here Saturday to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Arrivals on the same day included a mourners group of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Chairwoman Choe Un Bok, a mourners group of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. led by President Yun Kil Sang, An Hyang Jin, vice-chairwoman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia, and Ro Kil Nam, delegate of Minjok Thongsin, an Internet paper of Koreans in the U.S.
					
					Arriving on the same day were families of Ri Jae Dok and So Sun Ok, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters in China, the family of Ri Kwan Rin who was related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, and Jong Il Sim, Korean residing in Russia.

articles.title: Pyongyangites Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il Every day
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il Every day

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Pyongyangites continue visiting mourning places at their units every day in bitter grief and express deepest condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included mourners from the Hana Music Information Center, the Kwangbok Area Supermarket, the Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, the Tudan Duck Farm, the Raknang Ponghwa Garment Factory, the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, the Central Zoo and the Chilgol Vegetable Farm. 
					
					 Among them were those who grew to be officials under the loving care of Kim Jong Il and heroes of the era who performed their exploits in production and construction and deputies to People's Assemblies at various levels and scientists and technicians and other people who had the honor of being received by him and taking picture in his presence.
					
					 All of them renew their firm pledge to overcome the present sorrow and display strength and courage and remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, and successfully implement the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Pyongyang Railway Station Inundated with Mourners
articles.content:
Pyongyang Railway Station Inundated with Mourners

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Railway Station is crowded with people as usual but they are not passengers. 
					
					 After learning that leader Kim Jong Il passed away on train for pent-up mental and physical fatigue from his uninterrupted field guidance tour, they have come to the railway station to mourn his demise.
					
					 Kim Hyon Bok, a 51-year-old woman living in Yokjon-dong, Central District, told KCNA:
					
					  "Leader Kim Jong Il provided our people with good dwelling houses, but he ended his life on train in a cold winter day. I feel my heart rent for his demise. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il, please open your eyes. All the people wish you to come back. We will hold you in high esteem forever."

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Takes Measures for Mourners' Health
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Takes Measures for Mourners' Health

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Since it was reported on Monday that leader Kim Jong Il passed away so suddenly, all Pyongyang citizens have visited mourning sites in various parts of the city to express deep condolences before his large pictures with a broad smile on his face. 
					
					 With all the people wailing over his death, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, took special measures to set up more service facilities for mourners' health around the mourning sites.
					
					 He also gave instructions to officials to make an on-site survey of the situation and offer every possible convenience to the mourners.  
					
					 According to his instructions, more medical and hot drink service facilities and ambulances appeared in the mourning sites early Saturday morning.

articles.title: Korean People Seized with Bitter Grief at Loss of Their Leader
articles.content:
Korean People Seized with Bitter Grief at Loss of Their Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Smile has faded away from the faces of the Korean people from 12:00 Monday.
					
					 Seen in streets are only those with tears in their eyes and white flowers in their hands.
					
					 All families and all working places are seized with bitter sorrow for the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Documentary films showing his revolutionary activities are telecast every day in the country.
					
					 Watching the films, the people grieve over the loss of their leader, who devoted his all to the effort for providing them with a happy life and passed away in a cold winter day during his field guidance tour.
					
					 His field guidance tour for the happiness of the Korean people reached every nook and corner of the country.

articles.title: Portraits of Smiling Kim Jong Il Displayed in Provincial Seats
articles.content:
Portraits of Smiling Kim Jong Il Displayed in Provincial Seats

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il were displayed at all provincial seats reflecting the ardent desire of all servicepersons and people. This helps them draw inspiration from the benevolent image of the peerlessly great man.
					
					 An endless stream of people visit the places where those portraits are displayed. The places are crowded with mourners ardently missing the leader and vowing their loyalty. They turned into a veritable sea of tears shed by working people and youth and students, looking up to the portraits.
					
					 They are firmly determined to build a thriving socialist nation on this land under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages.

articles.title: Local People Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il Every Day
articles.content:
Local People Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il Every Day

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of people are turning out to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il upon hearing the sad news.
					
					 Officials and working people and school youth and children in South Phyongan Province ardently miss Kim Jong Il who wisely led the work to turn South Phyongan Province into a region good to live in and work.
					
					 Coal miners of the Anju Area Coal Mining Complex and the February 8 Jiktong Youth Coal Mine wept bitterly, thinking of the devotion and  tireless efforts made by Kim Jong Il for the development of the nation's coal industry.
					
					 Bitter lamentation was heard from mourners from the Sunchon Pharmaceutical Factory, the Sunchon Shoes Factory, the Tokchon Textile Mill, Ripsok and Ryongo Co-op farms in Mundok County, Sambong Co-op Farm in Phyongwon County and other units associated with his leadership feats.
					
					 Employees of the Phyongsong Synthetic Leather Factory could hardly repress their sorrow, looking up to the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il displayed in front of the Cultural Hall of South Phyongan Province. He told them to boost the production of goods liked by people.
					
					 Officials and workers of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, the Pukchang Thermal-power Complex and the Sungri Motor Complex renewed their pledge to increase the production of fertilizer, electricity and vehicles as desired by Kim Jong Il and  thus contribute to the building of a rich and powerful country.
					
					 Agricultural workers of the Wonhwa Co-op Farm in Phyongwon County who have the peerlessly great persons registered as its honorary farmers left the mourning place, feeling guilty for having failed to remain more loyal to him, and rushed to fields.
					
					 The whole land of Jagang Province is overwhelmed with grief over the loss of the father of the nation.
					
					 All people from officials of the party and power organs and working people's organizations to working people of industrial establishments and co-op farms and youth and students in the province grieved over the great loss of the father of the nation.
					
					 Workers of the Huichon Precision Machine Plant vowed to step up the work for putting the plant on a modern and scientific basis through a high-pitched drive to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology and bring about uninterrupted miracles and innovations in production and thus successfully carry out the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The similar pledge was made by officials and workers of the Kanggye Koryo Medicine Factory and the Kanggye Koryo Medicine Processing Factory honored with a series of visits paid by the leader.
					
					 Officials and working people in Usi, Chosan and Hwaphyong counties also renewed their pledge to increase the production at local industrial factories, cherishing the loving care shown by him for people of mountainous villages.

articles.title: Workers of Metal Industrial Sector Effort for Increased Production
articles.content:
Workers of Metal Industrial Sector Effort for Increased Production

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Korean workers of the metal industrial sector are turning out in the effort for implementing the behests of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The workers of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex are now striving to overfulfill their yearly production plan.
					
					 Over the past five days they have increased pig iron production 50 percent compared with the same days of last month.
					
					 The Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex has boosted the heavy rail production from December 22, while the Chollima Steel Complex has raised steel production to fully supply rails to coal mines. 
					
					 The Posan Iron Works has increased Juche iron output that leader Kim Jong Il had paid deep concern to in his lifetime.  
					
					 The Musan Mining Complex is keeping all equipment in full-capacity operation to raise iron ore production.
					
					 The workers of the Unryul, Jaeryong, Jangsan and Saenggiryong mines have also made redoubled effort for increased production, turning their grief into strength and courage.

articles.title: Korean People Get over Their Leader's Demise
articles.content:
Korean People Get over Their Leader's Demise

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Stillness has no longer persisted in Pyongyang Saturday morning, a week after the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Streets, buses and metro are all crowded with people going to their work. They are not giving way simply to sorrow.
					
					 They are getting over the demise of their leader, promoted by a strong will to closely rally around respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, identical to leader Kim Jong Il in ideology, leadership art and traits, and faithfully uphold his leadership. They are working with redoubled effort.
					
					 Jo Yong Gil, an employee of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, said, "How can I weep away my time, overcome with grief. I will work harder to implement the behests of leader Kim Jong Il."
					
					 Kim Kyong Su, manager of the complex, said, "We are now bringing about an upsurge in the manufacture and repair of electric locomotives after changing sorrow into strength and courage. All the workshops in the complex are overfulfilling their daily quotas. Our workers will uphold the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un with increased production."

articles.title: Iron-willed Brilliant Commander Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Iron-willed Brilliant Commander Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 It is a pride of the Korean army and people to celebrate the day of great significance in the destiny of the nation and socialism.
					
					 The struggle for defending the country in the late 20th century was a showdown without gunfire sounded.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists were escalating moves against the DPRK and severe natural disasters hit the country, adding to the hardships of the Korean revolution.
					
					 In that rigorous period leader Kim Jong Il overcame the manifold hardships with the KPA as the mainstay of the revolution.
					
					 He inspected many army units in Panmunjom, Mt. Osong, Hill 351, Height 1 211 and other frontline areas.
					
					 He, gifted with matchless courage and pluck, always stood in the forefront of the Korean people's struggle for triumphantly defending the country and making tremendous achievements in socialist construction.
					
					 Though they are suffering bitter grief at the demise of Kim Jong Il, the Korean army and people are determined to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Strengthening Army
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Strengthening Army

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il strengthened the Korean People's Army (KPA) into a revolutionary strong one equipped with modern offensive and defensive means capable of defeating any powerful enemy.
					
					 With a deep insight into the fast-changing international political situation in the 1990s and requirements of the developing revolution he started pursuing Songun (military-first) politics with the KPA as the main force for the first time in history. 
					
					 He wisely led the army to enhance its political and ideological might and military strength.
					
					 He also guided all commanding officers to successfully work out operational plans and command battles to suit modern war.
					
					 He inspected many units to teach Juche-based training methods and tactics and encourage soldiers to intensify training under the slogan "Training is also a battle!"
					
					 Inspired by his uninterrupted inspection of frontline units, the KPA soldiers displayed unparalleled bravery and performed heroic feats in defending the country.

articles.title: Songun-based Leadership Carried Forward by Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Songun-based Leadership Carried Forward by Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was an illustrious commander who creditably carried forward the tradition of Songun (army-first) leadership, the Juche-based revolutionary tradition which is an eternal treasure of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership with an inspection of the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, Juche 49 (1960). 
					
					 True to the cause of President Kim Il Sung, who started the Korean revolution by dint of arms, he considered Songun his lifelong political creed and engaged in the Songun revolutionary leadership for over five decades.
					
					 Having fully established the leadership system of the Workers' Party of Korea in the army in the 1960s, he directed much effort to implementing the party's military line of making the entire army a cadre army and modernizing it. 
					
					 In the 1970s, he provided a program for developing the KPA to be an army serving Kim Il Sung and the party and set forth a slogan "Let us fight devotedly for the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung!" 
					
					 Since then, the KPA has taken the van in faithfully upholding the leadership of the party and the leader.
					
					 Whenever he visited KPA units, he encouraged soldiers to intensify training and fully prepare for combat.
					
					 Under his Songun leadership, the KPA also took the lead in socialist construction. The working spirit and working style displayed by the army have greatly influenced the whole society.
					
					 His Songun politics entered a new stage in the 1990s, fully demonstrating the might of the DPRK.
					
					Kim Jong Il became the KPA supreme commander on December 24, 1991 and was awarded the title of the DPRK Marshal on April 20 next year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Warm Love for Soldiers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Warm Love for Soldiers

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- December 24 marks the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Upon hearing the news that Kim Jong Il passed away so suddenly, all the Korean servicepersons lament over his death, missing their close ties with the supreme commander. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il loved the soldiers so much. 
					
					 Whenever he inspected a unit, he always watched soldiers' training and paid deep concern to their political and ideological education and entertainment, encouraging them to do well in their military service. 
					
					 His warm love for the soldiers produced a harmonious whole between them and a great unity of the leader, army and people.

articles.title: Korean People Miss Supreme Commander
articles.content:
Korean People Miss Supreme Commander

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 The Korean people have celebrated the day significantly with all streets, villages, army units and industrial establishments garbed in festive attire.
					
					 This year, however, the day serves as an occasion for all the people to experience bitter grief at the loss of the supreme commander and sorely miss him.
					
					 Over the past two decades since Kim Jong Il became the supreme commander, the Korean people have resolutely fought to defend the socialist homeland without slightest vacillation though they suffered grief at the demise of President Kim Il Sung and serious damages from repeated natural disasters, while being harassed by the imperialists' persistent sanctions and moves to isolate the DPRK.
					
					 With a deep insight into the rigorous situation, Kim Jong Il started pursuing unique Songun (military-first) politics to successfully guide the army and the people, performing great exploits in the Juche-based army building. 
					
					 Under his Songun revolutionary leadership based on the love for the nation and the people, the DPRK has become a political and military power, manufactured and launched satellites and possessed nuclear weapons. 
					
					 On the occasion of the anniversary, the Korean army and people are determined to move up the final victory of the Juche-based revolutionary cause under the great leadership of Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il, Great General of Korea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il, Great General of Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 On this occasion, all the Korean servicepersons and people recollect with deep emotion the great exploits he performed for the country and people. 
					
					 The Korean people call him General Kim Jong Il.
					
					 This call is associated with their profound reverence for and unquestionable trust in the leader, who turned the DPRK into a dignified, invincible country.  
					
					 It also mirrors their unsparing praise of Kim Jong Il, who brought about signal achievements unprecedented in the Korean history, and their firm belief that they will always emerge victorious under his leadership.  
					
					 In the period of the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953), Kim Jong Il received a meaningful pistol from President Kim Il Sung and cultivated his pluck and stratagem, staying in the Supreme Command. 
					
					 When he entered Kim Il Sung University, Kim Jong Il climbed Ryongnam Hill to declare his will to successfully carry forward the cause started by the President.  
					
					 Thanks to his energetic leadership, the country turned into an impregnable fortress and launched satellites. Many modern industrial establishments have been built on a CNC basis throughout the country.
					
					 The army and people will continue demonstrating the dignity and might of the country, chanting "Long Live Great General Kim Jong Il!"

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Life Based on Comradeship
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Life Based on Comradeship

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il, born with a noble disposition of the Mangyongdae family members to devote their all to others, not to themselves, did all he could for his comrades in his lifetime. 
					
					 When starting to work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Il exchanged greetings with officials and requested them to call him comrade. 
					
					 He was of the view that relationship between the leader and officials was not commanding and obeying one but comradely relationship. 
					
					 This view was a key to the success of his politics.
					
					 One day he said it was his ideological creed that he was inseparably linked with comrades and that without comrades, there would be no Kim Jong Il. He said it was his view of comrades.
					
					 In his lifetime Kim Jong Il spared no pain for his comrades. His uninterrupted field guidance tour of all parts of the country is also based on his strong sense of comradeship.
					
					 Grieving for the loss of such a great comrade, the Korean army and people are resolved to carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche, upholding the leadership of Kim Jong Un, another great comrade.

articles.title: Revolutionary Cause of Juche Sure to Be Accomplished
articles.content:
Revolutionary Cause of Juche Sure to Be Accomplished

					  Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- December 24 is the significant day when leader Kim Jong Il assumed the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army 20 years ago. This year the servicepersons and people of the DPRK are commemorating this day with bitter sorrow and grief over his demise, a great loss to the nation. 
					
					 Their hearts are now breaking as they feel pangs of conscience for failing to fulfill their obligation as his disciples. 
					
					 They are, at the same time, looking back on the undying feats of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk who glorified all her life by devotedly defending the leader. 
					
					 She was an indomitable revolutionary fighter who set a brilliant example in devotedly defending the leader with transparent outlook on the leader.
					
					 She absolutely trusted President Kim Il Sung, pioneer of the Korean revolution and invincible and iron-willed commander, as lodestar of the nation and great man born of Heaven and protected him at the risk of her life with unshakable faith that prosperity of the country and nation are sure to come thanks to the President.
					
					 She protected the President at the risk of her life as a human shield and fortress in such fierce battles as battle at Hongqihe and Dashahe. Her noble image in those days still deeply touches the hearts of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK.
					
					 She fought against a renegade who spoke ill of the President's ideas at the Quingfeng secret camp and carried out the tasks assigned to her by the President without an inch of deflection. This brilliant history of struggle teaches as a practical example how a revolutionary soldier should defend and uphold the leader.
					
					 The spirit of devotedly defending the leader displayed by her in her noble lifetime serves as a textbook for the army and people of the DPRK in their life and struggle and the most precious legacy.
					
					 All servicepersons and people of the country are fully determined to remain loyal to Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche in the same spirit as displayed by her.

articles.title: Songun Revolutionary Exploits of Kim Jong Il Will Shine
articles.content:
Songun Revolutionary Exploits of Kim Jong Il Will Shine

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK mark December 24 this year weeping bitterly in the biggest sorrow at the untimely loss of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All the army and people have worked hard to significantly celebrate the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. Today they are looking back on his Songun revolutionary exploits in bitter tears.
					
					 It was a signal event in the nation's history that Kim Jong Il assumed the top post of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK.
					
					 Since he assumed the heavy responsibility as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il had performed the Songun revolutionary exploits to shine long, standing all tempests of the revolution.
					
					 With his distinguished political ability and invincible Songun revolutionary leadership he made immortal contributions to the country, nation, revolution and the cause of independence.
					
					 In the mid-1990s when the Korean revolution faced the worst trials and adversities, Kim Jong Il formulated Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism, thus setting up a fresh landmark for the development of the country and the revolution.
					
					 He led the country and the revolution with his original Songun political mode, which represents the organic combination of politics and military affairs, thereby enabling the DPRK's revolutionary armed forces to become strong revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu and helping the DPRK shed its rays as an invincible power winning victory after victory in reliance on the powerful political and military capabilities. The DPRK has become the most powerful socialist country strong in independent faith no formidable enemy dares provoke.
					
					 No political and diplomatic pressure, military blackmails, blockade and sanctions by the imperialists have ever worked on the DPRK.
					
					 Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have wrought the world-startling miracles in every domain including economy, culture, science and technology, resolutely smashing the vicious anti-DPRK confrontation and war moves by the reactionaries of history.
					
					 All the army and people have achieved the single-minded unity and built power enough to mount merciless military strike at the enemy while hardening their pledges to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution.
					
					 The work of turning the revolutionary ranks into elite forces with the KPA as a core has been pushed forward and the great army- people unity has been achieved on the basis of the army's mentality and its fighting spirit.
					
					 Thanks to the full display of the great mental power of the army and people world-startling changes took place in every construction site of building a thriving nation.
					
					 The Songun revolutionary exploits performed by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il in developing the KPA into the invincible revolutionary armed forces and creating the new history of great changes unprecedented in the nation's history spanning 5,000 years will always remain shining in the nation's history.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK marking December 24 this year are now replete with the firm pledge to be loyal to the revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: All Koreans Pay Highest Tribute to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
All Koreans Pay Highest Tribute to Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The image, footprints and voice of leader Kim Jong Il are deeply enshrined in the minds of the Korean people.
					
					 At this moment of profound grief over the loss of the father of the nation, they ardently miss him as he brought happiness to the people, always mixing with them and weathering difficulties.
					
					 He tirelessly made forced marches for field guidance to factories and farms to meet people despite severe snowstorms or sweltering heat.
					
					 It was his preoccupation to make his people happiest in the world. He made long journeys for creation and devotion in order to perform the above-said noble mission.
					
					 When officials wished to present a marshal's uniform to him, he said he liked to go in a jumper all the time and he found donning it comfortable as it is well known to the people. He also said he liked medal of hero more than marshal's star because it shines when there is the medal of hero.
					
					 People feel their hearts are aching when thinking of forced march, short and uncomfortable sleep, rice balls and wadded clothes about which they often talk when referring to his hardships.
					
					 His dress tells what he suffered and how heavy burden he was shouldering at every step.
					
					 Mourners bitterly grieve, when seeing Kim Jong Il in jumper which he donned in his lifetime.
					
					 In fact, he underwent so great hardships and did so many things for the country and its people. Yet, he never allowed the production of any single feature film depicting him. 
					
					 The people are, therefore, paying highest tribute to such great man. 
					
					 His immortal exploits will always win their admiration.

articles.title: Red Flag Fluttering Higher in DPRK
articles.content:
Red Flag Fluttering Higher in DPRK

					people are cherishing red flag at this time of national mourning over the loss of the father of the nation.
					
					 The bier of leader Kim Jong Il is being bedecked with red flag.
					
					 He was born as the son of guerrillas during the hard-fought anti-Japanese battles. He worked hard finding himself among the people all his life just as President Kim Il Sung did. The red flag reflects Kim Jong Il's whole life. 
					
					 He fluttered red flag on his way of energetic field guidance for people's happiness without having a moment's rest despite manifold hardships. The Korean people recorded heroic epic following the peerlessly great persons to win victory under the red flag.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are fluttering the red flag at the time of bitter grief over the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A lot of youth and students and working people are displaying patriotism to make contribution to the building of a prosperous country. All the people are effecting innovations at their revolutionary posts.
					
					 We have respected Kim Jong Un, great successor of the revolutionary cause of Juche!
					
					 We will make our country to which Kim Jong Il devoted his whole life the best thriving country in the world, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The red flag reflecting the spirit of the army and the people is now fluttering higher in the DPRK as ever before.

articles.title: Bean Milk Workshop Associated with Kim Jong Il's View of Children
articles.content:
Bean Milk Workshop Associated with Kim Jong Il's View of Children

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory has a large-scale bean milk workshop built for children on the initiative of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In his lifetime, he took measures to produce bean milk on a normal basis and provide the factory with up-to-date equipment.
					
					 When visiting the factory in July ten years ago, he highly appreciated the employees for having operated the factory non-stop in the period of the Arduous March when the country was in hard time.
					
					 The employees are now seized with grief at the demise of Kim Jong Il, but they continue producing bean milk, changing the grief into strength and courage.
					
					 A worker Kim Kyong Hui told KCNA:
					
					 "Leader Kim Jong Il said in his lifetime that it was his desire to have bean milk supplied to children on a regular basis. We are sorely missing him, who passed away after taking all necessary measures for the bean milk production for children."
					
					 The head of the workshop, Ri Yong Hui, said, "We deem it our duty to materialize leader Kim Jong Il's noble view of children. We will faithfully uphold the idea and leadership of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il."

articles.title: Birds Hover over Mourning Site in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Birds Hover over Mourning Site in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- Birds have hovered over the plaza of the April 25 House of Culture, crowded with people mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An Jong Hwa, a resident in Sosong District, told KCNA:
					
					 "When I was entering the plaza with a white flower in my hand on Friday morning, I saw tens of magpies clattering on the top of the front wall of the April 25 House of Culture where a large picture of leader Kim Jong Il was hung. 
					
					 They were seen by thousands of mourners. 
					
					 A flock of magpies flew here at 10:05 a.m. and their number reached more than 100 after 20 minutes."
					
					Kim Un Hui, a guide of the April 25 House of Culture, said:
					
					 "Koreans say that the magpie clatter in the morning omens a welcome guest. Whenever magpies clattered in the morning, we looked forward to seeing leader Kim Jong Il in this house of culture. It seems the magpies came here to console us in grief and share it with us."
					
					  Cameramen took pictures and video of magpies hovering over the plaza.

articles.title: Snowfall Makes Koreans Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Snowfall Makes Koreans Sorely Miss Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- December 24 marks the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Early this morning snow fell to cover the land of the country, enveloped in grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 But the snowfall gives no joy to the Korean people, even to children this time. It only makes them sorely miss Kim Jong Il.
					
					He deemed it his greatest happiness and pride to devote all his life to the country, revolution and the people.
					
					 He found his pleasure in devotedly working for the people. He, unconcerned about his disease, continued giving field guidance to army units, factories and farms in order to lay foundations of a thriving nation.
					
					 Ji Yong Song, a 70-year-old man living in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang told KCNA, "Snowfall makes me miss Kim Jong Il so much."

articles.title: Songs Reflect Strong Will of Korean People
articles.content:
Songs Reflect Strong Will of Korean People

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's TV and radio broadcast songs "Hold High the Red Flag", "Song of Comradeship" and "We'll Travel One Road Forever" when the whole world is mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 These songs, created many years ago, are still popular among the Korean people, who have advanced along the road of victory and glory, sharing the destiny with the Workers' Party, the leader and the country.
					
					 The songs reflect the Korean people's strong will to unite around their leader and accomplish his cause without fail.
					
					 Speaking to KCNA, Kim Il Nam, an officer of the Korean People's Army, voiced his determination to always share the will and destiny with respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, singing these songs.
					
					 Kim Jong Hwa, a 44-year-old woman living in Sukchon County, South Phyongan Province, said, "I will hold higher the red flag of the revolution dyed with blood shed by the revolutionary forerunners and uphold the leadership of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Korea Will Accomplish Cause of Songun under Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Korea Will Accomplish Cause of Songun under Kim Jong Un

					 Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean people will accomplish the cause of the Songun revolution to the end, definitely calling Kim Jong Un supreme commander, true to the oath they took before the bier of leader Kim Jong Il in bitter tears.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday stresses this in a political essay.
					
					 The sons and daughters of this country call Kim Jong Il Supreme Commander from the bottom of their hearts, looking up to him, their father who passed away with a red flag after bequeathing to the people the blue sky and the valuable assets he provided by dedicating his whole life and with Songun, the essay says, adding:
					
					 Unforgettable is the image of President Kim Il Sung on December 25, 20 years ago, who said full of satisfaction at the Meeting of the Company Political Instructors of the Korean People's Army: I firmly believe that the entire army will thoroughly implement any order of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and remain faithful to him.
					
					 Since then, Kim Jong Il had broken through the raging storms of history with the arms of Mt. Paektu and, in this protracted course, became our supreme commander whom the people revered in earnest.
					
					 Over the past 20 years the DPRK had to repel the allied enemies' moves to stifle it and overcome consecutive natural disasters. This was, in fact, a grim war only without declaration and gun report. 
					
					 For the people beloved by the President, and for the fatherland entrusted by him!
					
					 The heart of Kim Jong Il, the brilliant Songun commander, was burning with this faith everyday and every time. This faith finally drove out the dark clouds of aggression for good and brought the blue sky to this country. 
					
					 Then his long journey of inspection to the frontline was followed by his field guidance to where land rezoning and construction of power stations were going on and to farm fields and industrial worksites. Such energetic activities and devoted efforts deeply moved our people to look up to him as the true guardian and creator of their destiny and happiness.
